remarks: Cayley's Theorem (existence version): every group ` G ` is isomorphic to a subgroup of the symmetric group on the underlying set of ` G ` .  (For any group ` G ` there exists an isomorphism ` f ` between ` G ` and a subgroup ` h ` of the symmetric group on the underlying set of ` G ` .) See also Theorem 3.15 in [Rotman] p. 42.  (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 3-Mar-2008.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 13-Jan-2015.)
statement:

cayleyth $p |- ( G e. Grp -> E. s e. ( SubGrp ` H ) E. f e. ( G GrpHom ( H |`s s ) ) f : X -1-1-onto-> s ) $.
$d G f s $.
$d H f s $.
$d X f s $.
